website_summaries.verdict: Powerful brushless motor chainsaw easier operation features such as low kick-back and an Oregon bar.
pros: Less maintenance than a gas-powered saw
Low kickback and 16-inch Oregon bar and chain brake makes for easier handling
cons: Chain comes off easily on larger jobs
Must drain chain oil after each use

customer_reviews.title: Requirement to drain the chain oil after every use???
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy chainsaw for medium size projects. Worked very well cutting up decent sized limbs from a maple that came down in a storm. What I think is ridiculous and poor engineering is the requirement to drain the chain oil after every use. I've never had a chainsaw that has this requirement. I thought at first there was an issue with the saw, after moving in on the garage floor and finding a puddle of oil. Double checked the manual and noted the requirement. Not sure if it's ok to save it and reuse or a marketing campaign to sell more oil.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: issues keep the chain on and tight
customer_reviews.text: While the saw has the power to cut down decent sized trees, the chain comes off easily. The chain is rather narrow compared with other chainsaws. I believe this lends itself to jumping off the bar. I think it doesn't take much debris from the cutting action to foul the bar. Also the tool less chain adjustments are not capable of proper tension being placed on the chain to set the slack of the chain correctly. The narrow kerf of the chain also results in binding of the chain much more often that a typical chainsaw . The 40v 4 amp battery allows for hours of cutting before it needs to be recharged.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and well built.
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw is amazing. Very quiet and easy to service. I highly recommend buying extra oil as this saw goes through it rather quickly. Also get extra batteries if you plan on heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Jed J Harris

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Chainsaw and be prepared for something to break!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible chainsaw. I purchase this saw and during my first day of using it the chain tension tightening screw broke. I sent the saw back in for a new one and when I took the new saw out the same exact thing happened. Dewalt is my go to brand on tools but they really dropped the ball on this saw. This is a very cheaply made saw and I would not waste my time purchasing it!
customer_reviews.author: Brad W.

customer_reviews.title: For trimming and maintenance, this is a great saw.
customer_reviews.text: This saw continues to exceed my original expectations. Plenty of torque. Plenty of run-time. Quiet. Not only is this a great saw functionally, it sheds the inconvenience of a two-stroke. With instant-on full torque, you can more objectively plan your cuts because you don't have a two-cycle engine idling in your hands. You don't have to also have a gas mixture can around. You can set it down anywhere at any time because it is not hot, and there is no fuel tank to spill. I routinely get about 45 minutes of work out of a charge, by which time it's time for a break anyway.
customer_reviews.author: C. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, bad execution
customer_reviews.text: Good idea, bad execution. Ive been a fan of the Dewalt 40v tools, already own the hedge trimmer and the weed wacker. This one unfortunately disappoints. Power is good but battery lifespan is rather short using a 4ah 40v pack. Similar to another reviewer the chain oiler for this either didnt work right out of the box or died within the first use. Not sure if its clogged or a bad design but this unit will be going back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: DK43

customer_reviews.title: It's great for cutting saplings and trimming limbs
customer_reviews.text: It's great for cutting saplings and trimming limbs. I wouldn't use it to fell a tree larger than 4-6" in diameter and even then the chain seems to get stuck. Overall it's great for what it is but it won't replace my Stihl for real chainsaw work.
customer_reviews.author: Kiley Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about this product when I read what seemed to be mostly positive reviews. However, that soon turned to disappointment. On a full chatge, I only had about 15-20 minutes usage. Cutting power was almost useless. I'll just have to bite the bullet and buy a gas powered chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Battery Packs are junk!
customer_reviews.text: I used the chain saw twice in 2018 out it away for the season. Then tried this week, April 2019, to charge the pack and it won't charge. The charger indicates that the pack is defective. This is the second time this has happened. Once before with a Leaf Blower and now with the Chain Saw. I was hoping to share the expensive battery packs between two tools but now I have one battery pack for two tools. I am not happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: DRM

customer_reviews.title: Issue was not with the saw as it seems to ...
customer_reviews.text: Issue was not with the saw as it seems to work well - issue was the chain. Two of the teeth that engage the drive on the chainsaw were bent, so the chain will not guide down the bar and will slip on the drive. Going to get a new chain - and see if that will work **** After getting the new chain was able to completely cut up a 22" tree. happy with the product but the issue tainted the experience some.
customer_reviews.author: d.w

customer_reviews.title: This saw will add years to your life.
customer_reviews.text: This saw has probably added years to my life. I only use a chainsaw maybe once or twice a month usually. Trying to keep a gas powered saw maintained and running was always a challenge and usually left me frustrating and with an elevated blood pressure. I have no patience when it comes to small motors. Anyway... I already had the dewalt 40v trimmer and each one of the tools came with a battery which really comes in handy. Usually by the time I run one battery down, the other one is charged. I cut down a medium (40ft tall) pine tree and chopped it into bite sized pieces on one fully charged battery.
customer_reviews.author: Rann042

customer_reviews.title: this product is an amazing tool. Tired of tuning and mixing gas and ...
customer_reviews.text: As a former guy that cut firewood for a living, this product is an amazing tool. Tired of tuning and mixing gas and oil, I decided to give technology a try, and I am impressed. To push a button to start, that is a game changer. The point of actually cutting wood is what makes this chainsaw such an essential part of my outdoor projects. It is flawless. Straight and clean cuts. Plenty of power. Quick chain slack adjustment. A window to gauge chain oil. Battery indicator. This saw will completely change your old thinking about clean power. Wow!
customer_reviews.author: R. Payne

customer_reviews.title: This worked great for that
customer_reviews.text: After we had some trees pruned, we needed to cut the limbs into smaller pieces. This worked great for that. Granted, you'll need something more substantial if you're doing a large job or trying to cut really hard wood, but this is perfect for us. Most of our tools are DeWalt, and since the battery is interchangeable with the blower, weed wacker, etc., we didn't need to purchase another battery with the chainsaw. That was another plus.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cockrell

customer_reviews.title: Short life
customer_reviews.text: It worked great until it didn’t work at all, just about a month after the warranty expired. Used it for taking down bunch of small (<12”)trees on my 1.5 acre farm. I don’t feel like I gave it an overly exhaustive workout, the battery lasted long enough between charges that it was just about right for cutting, then clean-up. I quite liked it until it died, now I feel like it was a rip-off.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Gas Chainsaw Power With a 40V Battery
customer_reviews.text: I recently had to cut down the remaining 16 feet of a Queen Palm & fell it in 2-foot segments to avoid damaging surrounding sidewalks, lawn & gardens. While I own a gas powered chainsaw, I didn't want to annoy my neighbors with several hours of noise. Since I already own other DeWalt 40v tools, I purchased this as a bare tool (no battery or charger). As an owner of over a dozen DeWalt tools, I was again very impressed with the quality & power of this chainsaw. It is easily comparable to a gas powered chainsaw of similar bar size. Battery longevity is good.
customer_reviews.author: GMO

customer_reviews.title: Not so Great of A product, dont do it to yourself
customer_reviews.text: Awesome just uses a whole lot of oil and the chain will continue to get stuck jammed and come off to be honest I still love it. 4 months later. I used it once since I pur hased it to cut up a fallen tree. Since then it hangs out in the garage, all that it does now is leak chain oil all over my garage floor. I'm not proud of this purchase anymore. It absolutely sucks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy the saw cuts through wood. Battery lasts enough time for small to medium projects. I did not like the safety guard in front. It’s too close to my knuckles when holding the saw. I guess that’s why they have it there to protect my knuckles. Oil runs dry fairly quick too, but enough time for what I had to use it for. I only had to fill it once, but it was empty when I was done. ~1.5hrs on and off
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great For The Homeowner With A Large Yard!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and I don't have to worry about cutting up an extension cord! I've used this several times since purchasing it. It handled everything I threw at it from tree limbs to saplings. Some of the limbs were 4-6" in diameter hardwood. It delimbs dead stuff off living standing spruce trees with ease. Chain is sharp and cuts through wood like a knife through butter. Saw is nicely balanced and comfortable to use. It makes yard clean up a much easier and pleasant experience. Battery power is so much more convenient a time and energy saver.
customer_reviews.author: Macabee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to reassemble and beautifully engineered
customer_reviews.text: Had a large pine tree (approx 20" dia) fall in the backyard during hurricane Irma and ordered this chainsaw to get the cleanup job done. The Dewalt DCCS690M1 arrived in 2 days and is a real little monster. The tree didn't stand a chance. Surprisingly powerful and very well-built. I took the chain and bar off just to see how its done (and to clean it a bit). Easy to reassemble and beautifully engineered. I had no idea an electric could be so powerful. Excellent product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Chester

customer_reviews.title: Great design and technology
customer_reviews.text: Great Chainsaw that made me totally independent - no more "Honey do (or NOT)". I am a super small (senior) woman - 5'0" and under 95 pounds. I could use this to cut and trim trees I used to relay on guys to do. Simple, powerful, and easy-handling. I also like the "No tool" design - I took out the "chain cover" and clean out all the debris, then put the chain back. Good to go again.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: End of the line for 40V tools!  4AH battery is junk.
customer_reviews.text: By now this chainsaw might be sold out anyway, but DeWalt is clearly phasing out 40V tools. Hurry and buy anything you might want to run on your 40V batteries. 2 stars because the 4AH battery is useless! It ran for minutes and then died in weeks. Get the 6-8AH batteries. You'll want at least 2. Chainsaw is fine. Uses standard bars and chains. With bigger batteries it's fine for a non-lumberjack.
customer_reviews.author: Curmudgeon 23

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chainsaw 8 months ago and have been giving it a good workout. I love it so far. It does tend to throw the chain, but frequent tightening prevents it from happening. I've yet to experience issues with the self-oil feature that others have reported. I wish it came in larger sizes as I have bigger trees to cut. But, I am thrilled by the saw's low maintenance and the fact there are no plugs to foul.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dreamy
customer_reviews.text: Best chainsaw I've ever owned. Just not having a pull start is worth every penny. I have the battery blower and hedger also. I use those batteries on the chainsaw for bigger projects like taking out a large oak. The extra batteries keep the project moving.
customer_reviews.author: MrDagist

customer_reviews.title: So close, so very very close
customer_reviews.text: I have had a chance to use the saw a couple of times. It has heft - a little heavy to carry but the weight helps in cutting. The cutting is effortless, fast and clean. Can't tell you about the battery because it still shows full charge. Chain adjustment is fast and simple. Changing the chain is very, very easy and quick. This saw is a five star minus one star for the oiler. This oiler is to say the least, a leaking mess. You get oil everywhere and sets in a puddle of oil after a few minutes of down time. I really like this saw! DEWALT FIX THE OILER!
customer_reviews.author: A. Eric Brewington

customer_reviews.title: I like it. I burned through an entire Orange Osage ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I burned through an entire Orange Osage tree in a couple of hours...BUT YES - It sucks up bar and chain oil like a pirate doing the stanky leg with a barrel of rum...yes.
customer_reviews.author: Cloudedeye

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: After four decades of using a gas chainsaw I wasn't expecting a great deal. I am amazed at the power and it is as if I am using a gas powered chainsaw. If you were going to collect 10 cords of wood a year you probably want a gas powered which since a battery does not quite last as long as gas can.
customer_reviews.author: Tempus Fugit

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to gas saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw Pros. Reasonably light Reasonable battery life Cuts like a gas powered saw Quiet works great like all my DeWalt tools Well constructed easy to start and stop Cons. Battery takes hours to charge
customer_reviews.author: garyg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw. I have a damaged shoulder and can't ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome saw. I have a damaged shoulder and can't pull a recoil starter, so I gambled on this saw. This saw works so well, lots of power and battery life. And I'm cutting oak and hickory, for firewood! I highly recommend this saw, as does my wife, she even uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rado

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my new saw
customer_reviews.text: ok let's get straight to it. I LOVE my new saw. I am a logger now, and I am only 5'5" and about 115 pounds, so if it wasn't for this lightweight super duty little chainsaw I would never get to turn that downed forest into my wood stove lengths for a Montana winter. The battery goes forever, the power is great, ....I need to sharpen the blades now yes, and I was surprised how often I have to fill the small oil reservoir, but really this saw is fantastic thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Easy to use, light weight. Single 4Ah battery did an entire 30 foot tree cutting down and cutting up into pieces. SO much easier than gas and quiet during use so neighbors aren't disturbed by noise. Another great Dewalt product. Arrived fast and well packaged. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Sick of your gas axe, BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: This is not for professionals unless you do small jobs only. For a homeowner, like myself, with 3 acres and many trees, it is AWESOME. I use my 7.5 AH batteries and I can't believe how long it lasts. It has plenty of power to cut 16". I honestly would cut 30" if you were able cut all the way around. If I didn't mention this already, IT HAS LOTS OF POWER. BUY IT ALREADY.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Gas saw’s worst nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Eats gas chainsaws for lunch. I purchased this for my mentally challenged brother. He’s a wood turner and needed a way to process wood. This was perfect due to his fear of gas saws due to noise and vibrations. He and I processed over 100 blanks on a charge, cut threw a 30 inch trunk. I wouldn’t hesitate to replace a gas chainsaw with this. It’s much safer and easier then gas.
customer_reviews.author: Buys to much

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Chainsaw - No Choke!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this chainsaw to cut down several four and five inch diameter trees on our property. I then removed the branches and sectioned the trunks. I've cut down and processed three trees in an afternoon and never had the battery run down. Plenty of power, super simple to use, easy access to chain oil fill and blade tension adjustment. Of course, the chain oil does leak out even when not in use, but no worse than any other chainsaw I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect alternative to my gas powered chainsaw-very easy to use, especially if you are a woman. Just buy extra bar oil and keep the batteries dry.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth B.

customer_reviews.title: Everything DeWalt is AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: As always I am fully impressed by DeWalt Tools. While I've never used a gas powered chainsaw, I have seen them in action many times, and I highly doubt they operate as well as this 60V Max. I cut through 12" of oak in about 15 seconds, without putting any pressure on the saw. It is light and easy to maneuver in the tree. There is NO kickback, and for the little jumps that occasionally occur, the safety automatically stops the chain!
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: I love this chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I love this chainsaw, though I'm not a pro, I use this around my house on a couple acres of land. If you're a homeowner looking for a nice, convenient chainsaw, this one is it!
customer_reviews.author: CSherr

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY POWERED SAW....
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected except for chain oil which seems to inject more than is needed. Chain oil usage is high. Battery power is superb...lasts a long time under light duty. Perfect for my intermittent use. Have yet to re-charge but only used a few hours. Convenience of no gas, oil, spark-plug trumps all. Starting no hassle, clean, variable speed as needed. Recommend a carrying case which can be purchased at Home Depot for $40, cloth case with plastic bottom to keep oil dripage contained.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M Smith

customer_reviews.title: Performs great I'm an amateur taking care of some windfall
customer_reviews.text: Performs great I'm an amateur taking care of some windfall. This product works great I only with the fluid resivoir was larger and the chain tightening knob more solid. The charge does last awhile 2-3 hours of use continuous.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Far Exceeded My Expectations
customer_reviews.text: This thing has more power than I expected it to have. It works great. Smooth and fast. I would absolutely buy this again. I would say for long jobs a second battery may be something to consider. But just the occasional tree for fire wood and trimming trees around the yard that 6AH battery is great.
customer_reviews.author: SilverSuperman

customer_reviews.title: Great battery operated chain saw
customer_reviews.text: I hate to start a two cycle engine. With the battery model, just put in the battery and hit the trigger. Blade is narrow so you have to be careful to keep it tight and make straight cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Broke on second use.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for about 45 minutes on the first day and 15 on the second when the chain adjustment mechanism failed. Took it to my local factory service center for a refund. Now I’m waiting 10 weeks for a check.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Not used professionally but has great power and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Not used professionally but has great power and cuts smoothly. Leaks chain oil when sitting for a while so be careful where you store it. Only used it for half an hour so far so can't say how long the charge will last but I'm impressed with how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy....Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase made in a while. Not for use if I where cutting down a large tree, but unbeatable for cutting up a tree or trimming a tree, and perfect for storm clean up. Uses a lot of bar oil, but that is good I'm my book. Just keep an eye on it, so as to not run out.
customer_reviews.author: PACO2YOU

customer_reviews.title: Great little chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: This is one that I replaced one that got stolen. I use it a lot to cut branches and trees. I have two Stihl chainsaws but grab this most of the time. Has good battery life and haven't found anything it won't cut.
customer_reviews.author: Horse rider

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw. Plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: Nice saw. Plenty of power. Battery seems to last. Cut through approximately 50 8" to 12" Oak and Chinese Tallow logs and battery still had 3 lights. It does use a lot of oil on the chain though. Used the whole reservoir for the 50 cuts. I would recommend this saw.
customer_reviews.author: GMurphy

customer_reviews.title: I love it! And my husband loves it because I ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a work horse! I love it! And my husband loves it because I can just push the button and go, I don't have to have him pull start it. It cuts through stuff like butter.I have a shoulder replacement and I'm so glad I can just put the battery in and go. My FAVORITE TOOL!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: works good for smaller jobs. doesn't leak bar oil any differently than my gas powered. works good
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: this chainsaw is better than the gas, no additives, no mixes, no mess. Always ready, powerful and reliable. get rid of the old gas chainsaw and use this, simple to use, no noise, no smoke. I use it less than 2 hours every weekend and I enjoy it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: I love this DeWalt chainsaw.  Easy to use, quiet and no mixing of fuel.
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw. No fuel mix, quiet, cuts great. Highly recommend for casual homeowner use. I own 5 chain saws range from 36 inch down to 14 inch pole saw and this is by far my favorite. Plus you can use the batteries in other DeWalt tools.
customer_reviews.author: Mighty E

customer_reviews.title: Works as well or better that a gas model
customer_reviews.text: Fells like a regular 16" chain saw ... maybe a bit lighter. Cool thing is it is completely quiet unless your using it! Great power ... at least as good as a gas model. I used it for over an hour on some fairly light duty smaller sectioning smaller trees and trimming some larger shrubs and didn't put a dent in the battery power.
customer_reviews.author: Brad & Dawn Braun

customer_reviews.title: Great Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw works like a charm. The 40V batteries give it lots of power and last as long as you'd expect a battery powered chainsaw to last. The trick is to keep a second battery powered up and ready to go if you're cutting medium sized trees up. For small branches and brush, no problem. with one battery. The blade was sharp out of the box and it doesn't weigh a ton. The only negative is when it's sitting it leeks chain oil from the reservoir for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Semmian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love my chainsaw! It works great, light weight, quiet and I just feel safer using it than my old gas chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: Lee TB

customer_reviews.title: Works well for few months
customer_reviews.text: Loved the saw at first and I have several gas saws. The only down side is the chain comes off too frequently. On small hard branches it comes off every couple of minutes. I finally had to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
customer_reviews.text: This is a super-sharp chain saw. It has all the power that I need. What a relief from having to add a fuel mixture and from having to yank a starter rope.
customer_reviews.author: Chupacabra

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: No mixing gas/oil NO yanking a pull cord! Excellent power Should have purchased long ago worth a few extra bucks
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mason

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: You only get about 10 cuts out of battery with it unless you're cutting branches. It does cut well non the less. Batteries cost $200 so a gas powered is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for the small things
customer_reviews.text: Used for an afternoon with no issues cutting small trees and clearing branches. Got it for the "small" stuff and batter lasted long enough to clear about 30 spruce branches. Saw feels balanced and not too heavy to manipulate.
customer_reviews.author: Doug C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent runtime.
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised by how long the runtime is. I got tired even before the battery power runs out. It's a lot lighter than the gas powered one, and there is no compromise on the power I got from this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Bing

customer_reviews.title: Great small chainsaw for taking down and cutting up some ...
customer_reviews.text: Great small chainsaw for taking down and cutting up some trees that fell across the path to the range and the driveway in various storms. While short of the power of a gas saw it does very well in its class on a full charge.
customer_reviews.author: David Robins

customer_reviews.title: Careless verification of working products.
customer_reviews.text: I can't give a product review on a product that came with a nonworking battery.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Akins

customer_reviews.title: Great little chain-saw...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, except it leaks a bit of oil when not in use. Oh, well... Oils well, that ends well!
customer_reviews.author: Norm Farnum

customer_reviews.title: A great option for a chainsaw!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes as a home owner it met all my expectations and more. I would highly recommend this product to homeowners who really don't have a need for a "Gas" chain saw this product will meet and exceed all your homeowner needs.
customer_reviews.author: R. RYAN

customer_reviews.title: I am completely satisfied with the DeWalt CDDS690H1
customer_reviews.text: This is a my first cordless electric chainsaw. Immediately after unboxing it, I inserted the battery and began to saw a 10-inch log. The saw has the look, feel, and power of a gas-powered chainsaw. I am completely satisfied with the DeWalt CDDS690H1. I enthusiastically recommend it to anyone who is looking for their first chainsaw or to switch from gasoline to electric.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew F. Ware

customer_reviews.title: Good chainsaw, short battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. It is light, easy to use and maintain, and it didn't break the bank. My main concern is that the battery life is less than stellar so you need additional batteries which are $100+ per battery. Overall I'd say the product is worth it, even with such considerations.
customer_reviews.author: EDC

customer_reviews.title: I love this saw
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because the gas ones were always so hard to start. I love this saw. I have cut down about 4 trees averaging 16" diameter and cut them up. It cuts like a dream and is not as heavy as the other saws. It always starts...
customer_reviews.author: DBH

customer_reviews.title: I only use a chain saw a few times per year and this is the best solution by far
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but worth it. Very powerful and effective cutting. I agree with other reviewers that the chain oiler reservoir is problematic .... too small and leaks oil. So much nicer the jacking around with gasoline saws. I only use a chain saw a few times per year and this is the best solution by far.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: Works great, one 4ah battery trimmed 3 palm trees and cut up the palms. I had no issues with bar oil leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Toby

customer_reviews.title: Generally a good saw but there again it all depends on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Generally a good saw but there again it all depends on the size of limbs or trunks one needs to saw. For example if you have several limbs of one to two inches in diameter, obviously this is the wrong tool. To do the job right, there is a need for one or more "additional" saws.
customer_reviews.author: NJluke

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding chain saw
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding saw. Holds a solid charge for a little over an hour. Used it the first time after a recent storm. It surpassed my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: A great saw. Battery lasts well
customer_reviews.text: A great saw. Battery lasts well. Much nicer than using a saw with a cord. Much nicer than using a gas saw.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: cuts with the power of a gas saw, much less hassle. Just need to watch and add chain oil so you don't run out
customer_reviews.author: tall kid

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Love the lightweight and power of this chainsaw. Eats oil pretty fast but I understand that this is typical for chainsaws.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Great Cordless Chainsaw!!
customer_reviews.text: Great chainsaw that puts plenty of oil on the chain and does not bog down when cutting big oak logs. The 4 ah batteries has plenty of power for cutting up the big oak logs and the ease of use beats the heck out of a gas chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wathen

customer_reviews.title: It is great I will recommend it for anyone needing a few trees under 18" cut.  Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I cut down and trimmed a 18" Sweet gum tree with no problem at all I did need to add oil and recharge battery about every 30 min.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home use, It works just as well as a gas saw..
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed.. does the job with no gas smell, no start up issues, and the battery last for a long time.( 45 minutes ).
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great way to keep up on the yard without storing mix gas.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent H. Leffler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Happy not to ever pull a cord again. This is exactly what I needed. Thumbs up!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very good machine
customer_reviews.text: I got the 6 ah battery and my back got tired while the battery still had power. This a great machine for home use lots of power no more gas mixing no more wasted time with noisy motors
customer_reviews.author: allen affleck

customer_reviews.title: This saw is a great addition to my equipment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut up several trees that fell during a storm. The saw performed flawlessly. If you plan on using it for a full day, you will need one or two spare batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like buttah
customer_reviews.text: This has plenty of power for what I need. It's actually impressively powerful and relatively low maintenance. I'm sure some people will say it's not as powerful as some gas chainsaws but I cut through small trees like butter, so I'm good.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Vieira

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happier with our purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect in every sense. When overlanding or just locally here at home it cuts up to 15” with ease. Better than we ever expected from a battery operated saw!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: well built but front cover erode easily by cutting chips
customer_reviews.author: fact

customer_reviews.title: Much better than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this chainsaw to clear out two trees and a couple of bushes and it made short work of the job. It is powerful enough and I like the convenience of the battery power. I have fought with gas powered chainsaws in the past and wasted time trying to start them enough to appreciate the quick start with the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Love how quiet it is. I had never used a chainsaw myself, and it was very easy!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Guyton

customer_reviews.title: Quick start, strong cutting
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw! Being able to cut, use nippers, go back to using saw without having the pull start of a gas saw is very convenient . Plenty of power to go with the no hassle start! The no tool adjustments are great too.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy K. Mattern

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw was easy to use, simple instructions, cut fast and was light flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Al Alcantara

customer_reviews.title: Powerful battery chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Great chainsaw with the power of a gas chainsaw. The battery is long lasting. I cut down and corded up a 12" diameter tree on one charge.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Keep the chain oiled, it goes through the oil quick!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to use around the yard. Not for big jobs but handles well for battery powered chain saw. Uses a lot of bar and chain oil but easy to disassemble and clean. Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great trimmer saw, light enough to work over your head.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: ... around the house and trimming limbs it has been perfect. Haven't tried to drop any trees with it ...
customer_reviews.text: For using around the house and trimming limbs it has been perfect. Haven't tried to drop any trees with it but perfect for casual using. No real complaints about battery
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Amazing power and cutting performance
customer_reviews.text: Amazing power and cutting performance, (for it's class of chainsaw). It is extremely convenient for limbing and/or jobs where you are constantly starting and stopping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This a great product. Cuts great
customer_reviews.text: This a great product. Cuts great, long run time, no mixing gas and oil, no pulling to start, just add chain oil and push a button and your ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Battery Powered Tool
customer_reviews.text: No issues to date, been using my new saw for various chores and I have yet to run the batter dry during use. Great mobile tool to get the job done quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt chain saw
customer_reviews.text: Uses a lot of oil, but excellent saw. Very quiet!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Power to spare for most jobs
customer_reviews.text: Lots of power; handy size unit. I love it! I would not use it on giant trees but for most usage (less than 12 inch diameter), it is more than adequate. Would buy again. Use it so much that I now need a chain sharpener as chains get expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and easy
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful for a battery operated saw. Can cut large 12” tree. Easy to handle. Works a couple hours on charge
customer_reviews.author: Clinician B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and convenient saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chainsaw with an extra 40V 6AH Dewalt battery (would really recommend a 2nd battery if you doing a lot of cutting)...and could not be happier. I have used it to cut some big pine trees on our property, small trees, branches around the garden.....all fast easy and with little maintenance. Just keep your eye on the oil level, sharpen the chain (I would buy one or two extra ones) and you are good to go. I would say each battery gives you about 30 min of hardcore cutting but if you get a 2nd battery with the charger plugged in you can cut all day long with this baby.
customer_reviews.author: Socrates

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it, it's sitting on my bench with my 180 Stihl gasser. Love having options.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Portable, Ease of use!
customer_reviews.text: It worked great. My husband said it’s perfect for what he needs it for. Didn’t use much battery life for the job he used for.
customer_reviews.author: Bambi L.Phalen

customer_reviews.title: Woderful chain saw that cuts as advertised and that elimnates ...
customer_reviews.text: Woderful chain saw that cuts as advertised and that elimnates all of the problems with gas chain saws. Dewalt has done it again.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

product_meta.title: DEWALT DCCS690B 40V Lithium Ion XR Brushless 16" Chainsaw (Tool Only)
product_meta.description: Style:No BatteryThe DEWALT DCCS690B 40V MAX Lithium Ion XR Brushless 16" Chainsaw (Baretool) delivers the performance of gas with the convenience of cordless. Equipped with a powerful brushless motor and a low kick back 16-in Oregon bar and chain, this chain saw glides through a variety of cutting diameters with the cut speed of gas and reliability of battery-powered equipment. For optimal convenience, the unit features auto-oiling with LubriLink and LubriWell delivering smooth cuts, long chain life and reduced maintenance. The quarter-turn oil cap allows for quick oil re-fills. It also features a tool-free tensioning system which allows for quick bar and chain adjustments with no additional tools required. This chainsaw is also equipped with a chain brake for kick back protection, along with a variable speed trigger for user control. This is a bare tool item - battery sold separately.
feature_bullets: The performance of gas with the convenience of cordless with a powerful brushless motor; Weight without Batteries : 9.1 lbs
Low kick-back 16" Oregon bar and chain, with a chain brake for kick back protection
Auto-Oiling with Lubrilink and Lubriwell for continuous lubrication
Tool free chain tensioning and bar tightening knob for proper bar clamping force
*Maximum initial battery voltage (measured without a workload) is 40 volts. Nominal voltage is 36

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars342 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
